instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 Brain dead?
threads.message:
Hi guys, we sold this mac 6 month ago to trusted client.
The machine was before used in our store for almost one year without issues. Never repaired before...

Anyway... 
No post, No usb activity ,machine turns on , green and amber light , no fan spin but I assume that is normal on this model.
ALL_SYS_PWRGD drop to low once and then says high. Cpu get warm after a while.
Fan goes high speed on SMC bypass but nothing happens.

I checked all the SPI lines and all resistors and everything is OK.
Also tried a good bin file and another chip from same model of donor board.
No signs of liquid damage or whatsoever... Everything seems in good shape.

Any clues?

threads.title: 820-4924 Brain dead?
threads.message:
Do you get CPU core voltage?
PLT_RESET_L comes high?

threads.title: 820-4924 Brain dead?
threads.message:
PPVCC_S0_CPU=1,69v 
PLT_RESET_L act same as ALL_SYS_PWRGD : 3,3v when i connect magsafe, drop to 0v after few seconds and gets and stays high at 3,3v.

threads.title: 820-4924 Brain dead?
threads.message:
Looks like CPU issue.
Heat it for test; no more than 200 degrees, for 15-20s...
